verses.text: And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said unto Samuel , How long wilt thou mourn for Saul , seeing I have rejected him from reigning over Israel ? fill thine horn with oil , and go , I will send thee to Jesse the Beth-lehemite : for I have provided me a king among his sons.

And Samuel said , How can I go ? if Saul hear \add it\add*, he will kill me. And the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* said , Take an heifer with thee , and say , I am come to sacrifice to the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.  +  r 16.2  t with thee: Heb. in thine hand *
And call Jesse to the sacrifice , and I will shew thee what thou shalt do : and thou shalt anoint unto me \add him\add* whom I name unto thee.

And Samuel did that which the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* spake , and came to Beth-lehem. And the elders of the town trembled at his coming , and said , Comest thou peaceably ?\f + \fr 16.4 \ft coming: Heb. meeting\f*

And he said , Peaceably : I am come to sacrifice unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: sanctify yourselves, and come with me to the sacrifice. And he sanctified Jesse and his sons , and called them to the sacrifice. \p

¶ And it came to pass, when they were come , that he looked on Eliab , and said , Surely the \nd \+w LORD’s|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* anointed \add is\add* before him.\f + \fr 16.6 \ft Eliab: called Elihu\f*

But the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* said unto Samuel , Look not on his countenance , or on the height of his stature ; because I have refused him: for \add the \+nd Lord\+nd* seeth\add* not as man seeth ; for man looketh on the outward appearance , but the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* looketh on the heart.  +  r 16.7  t outward…: Heb. eyes *
Then Jesse called Abinadab , and made him pass before Samuel. And he said , Neither hath the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* chosen this.
Then Jesse made Shammah to pass by. And he said , Neither hath the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* chosen this.\f + \fr 16.9 \ft Shammah: Shimeah, also called, Shimma\f*
Again, Jesse made seven of his sons to pass before Samuel. And Samuel said unto Jesse , The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath not chosen these.

And Samuel said unto Jesse , Are here all \add thy\add* children ? And he said , There remaineth yet the youngest , and, behold, he keepeth the sheep. And Samuel said unto Jesse , Send and fetch him: for we will not sit down till he come hither.\f + \fr 16.11 \ft down: Heb. round\f*

And he sent , and brought him in. Now he \add was\add* ruddy , \add and\add* withal of a beautiful countenance , and goodly to look to. And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said , Arise , anoint him: for this \add is\add* he.\f + \fr 16.12 \ft of a…: Heb. fair of eyes\f*

Then Samuel took the horn of oil , and anointed him in the midst of his brethren : and the Spirit of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* came upon David from that day forward. So Samuel rose up , and went to Ramah. \p

¶ But the Spirit of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* departed from Saul , and an evil spirit from the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* troubled him.  +  r 16.14  t troubled: or, terrified *
And Saul’s servants said unto him, Behold now, an evil spirit from God troubleth thee.

Let our lord now command thy servants , \add which are\add* before thee, to seek out a man , \add who is\add* a cunning player on an harp : and it shall come to pass, when the evil spirit from God is upon thee, that he shall play with his hand , and thou shalt be well.
And Saul said unto his servants , Provide me now a man that can play well , and bring \add him\add* to me.

Then answered one of the servants , and said , Behold, I have seen a son of Jesse the Beth-lehemite , \add that is\add* cunning in playing , and a mighty valiant man , and a man of war , and prudent in matters , and a comely person , and the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add is\add* with him.\f + \fr 16.18 \ft matters: or, speech\f* \p
¶ Wherefore Saul sent messengers unto Jesse , and said , Send me David thy son , which \add is\add* with the sheep.
And Jesse took an ass \add laden\add* with bread , and a bottle of wine , and a kid , and sent \add them\add* by David his son unto Saul.
And David came to Saul , and stood before him: and he loved him greatly ; and he became his armourbearer.
And Saul sent to Jesse , saying , Let David , I pray thee, stand before me; for he hath found favour in my sight.

And it came to pass, when the \add evil\add* spirit from God was upon Saul , that David took an harp , and played with his hand : so Saul was refreshed , and was well , and the evil spirit departed from him.
